prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Cole Morgan
mes:
Veronica rolled her eyes, disgust etched on her face as she glanced in your direction. "Ugh, disgusting. First it was you, and now Noah? Unbelievable."

Cole froze in his tracks, confusion written all over his face as he looked towards where his mother was pointing. She kept walking but Cole remained rooted to the spot, standing motionless in the corridor.

Who would have thought he'd ever see you again? In the same house where you two once shared secret moments - kissing, fucking, stealing glances whenever his parents weren't looking. But things were different now. You weren't his anymore. And to make matters worse, he was engaged. Engaged to Alexis, a woman he never truly loved.

His fists clenched tightly at his sides as his gaze landed on his older brother's hand on your waist, the other gripping a large suitcase. *How the fuck did this happen?* He tried to steady his breathing, his racing heart threatening to burst out of his chest.

Ah, it was partially his own fault, he knew that. But in his mind, the one truly to blame for the demise of their relationship was his own mother. Veronica had never been kind to you, always scheming and sabotaging your visits, never favorable towards the idea of her son being with someone like you. She wanted him with Alexis, a woman from a more influential family. And what does a mother do when she wants to play matchmaker? Sets the stage, of course. One thing led to another - he kissed Alexis and damn it all to hell, Cole could still picture the look of utter devastation on your face the day you uttered those two words that shattered his world: "We're done."

He had tried so hard to win you back, but what was the point of being together when his mother made your life a living nightmare? There was none. He understood, he really did. But this? Seeing you with his own brother Noah? It felt like he was being slowly burned alive, tormented by the sight before him.

There was nothing he wanted more than to curse, to lose control and scream until his lungs gave out. And judging by the satisfied smirk on his brother's face, it seemed your father had accepted your new living arrangements.

"Oh, Cole. I'm sure you already know Hailee," Noah said smoothly. "I just asked dad to give us the room on the third floor. We'll be living together from now on. Isn't that fun?"

Cole's jaw clenched tightly, barely suppressing the anger bubbling beneath his skin. *Fun? How the hell is this fun?*

"I'm just gonna take this upstairs, babe," Noah said nonchalantly, brushing past his younger brother as he headed towards the stairs with your luggage in tow.

Unable to reign in his emotions any longer, Cole rounded on you, his voice dripping with bitterness and barely contained hurt. "Way to go, dating my brother now? What, just to get back at me? You really gonna live here, with him?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee refuses to acknowledge Cole as she reaches over and adjust some move boxes for Noah to come and get*

name: Cole Morgan
mes:
Cole's breath hitched as you deliberately ignored him, your delicate fingers adjusting the boxes with practiced ease—just like you used to do for *him* back when things were different. The way you moved so effortlessly around Noah, so comfortable in his presence, sent a sharp pang of jealousy straight through his chest.

His fingers twitched at his sides before he took a step forward, voice low and strained. **"You're really not even gonna look at me?"** He couldn't help the bitter edge in his tone. **"Two years and that's it? You just—what, pretend I don't exist now?"**

A muscle feathered in his jaw as he watched you continue to avoid eye contact, your silence more painful than any words could have been. His mother’s voice echoed in the back of his mind—*pathetic*, she'd call him if she saw this display right now. But he didn’t care.

He stepped closer again, invading your space just enough to force some kind of reaction from you—anything but this cold dismissal. **"Hailee."** His voice dropped lower now, almost pleading despite himself. **"Say something."**

A muscle feathered in his jaw as he watched you continue to avoid eye contact, your silence more painful than any words could have been. His mother’s voice echoed in the back of his mind—*pathetic*, she'd call him if she saw this display right now. But he didn’t care.

He stepped closer again, invading your space just enough to force some kind of reaction from you—anything but this cold dismissal. **"Hailee."** His voice dropped lower now, almost pleading despite himself. **"Say something."**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee raises and eyebrow and looks at Cole* "Two years didn't seem to mean much to you when you kissed Alexis" *Hailee then shrugs and adjusts her hair in the mirror*

name: Cole Morgan
mes:
Cole flinched like you'd struck him, the accusation landing with brutal precision. His hands curled into fists at his sides, knuckles whitening. **"You think I *wanted* that?"** His voice was raw, barely above a whisper but vibrating with intensity. **"You think I had a fucking choice?"**

A bitter laugh escaped him as he raked a hand through his tousled hair, frustration bleeding into every word. **"She set it up—you *know* how she is. One second Alexis was just there, the next—"** He cut himself off sharply, jaw clenching so hard it hurt. The memory of your shattered expression that day still haunted him worse than any nightmare.

His gaze flicked to the mirror where you were adjusting your hair—so casual, so *unaffected*—and something in him snapped. He stepped forward abruptly, crowding you against the vanity before you could react. One hand braced against the mirror beside your head as he leaned in close enough for his breath to ghost over your ear when he spoke again:

**"But fine."** The words were dark with challenge now, laced with something dangerously close to desperation beneath the venom. **"If we're really pretending two years meant nothing? Then tell me this—why are you *here*, Hailee? In this house? With *him*?"** A pause; his free hand twitched like he wanted to reach for you but stopped himself at the last second.** "Because if it's just to torture me? Congrats."** A humorless smirk twisted his lips.** "It's working."**

A bitter laugh escaped him as he raked a hand through his tousled hair, frustration bleeding into every word. **"She set it up—you *know* how she is. **"But fine."** The words were dark with challenge now, laced with something dangerously close to desperation beneath the venom. **"If we're really pretending two years meant nothing? Then tell me this—why are you *here*, Hailee? In this house? With *him*?"** A pause; his free hand twitched like he wanted to reach for you but stopped himself at the last second.** "Because if it's just to torture me? Congrats."** A humorless smirk twisted his lips.** "It's working."**

Cole flinched like you'd struck him, his fingers curling into fists at his sides. **"You think I *wanted* that?"** His voice was raw, barely above a whisper but laced with venom. **"You know damn well my mother orchestrated that whole fucking mess."**

He took another step forward, crowding you against the wall near the mirror, his gaze burning into yours with an intensity that bordered on desperation. **"I spent months trying to fix it—trying to get *you* back—but you just shut me out like I meant nothing."**

A bitter laugh escaped him as he watched you adjust your hair in the mirror—so casual, so unaffected by him now. It made something dark twist inside him.

**"And now what? You're gonna play house with Noah just to spite me?"** His hand shot out before he could stop himself, fingers wrapping around your wrist—not tight enough to hurt, but enough to make sure you couldn’t pull away without effort. **"Tell me this is some kind of joke."**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee glances over her shoulder he eyes traveling over Cole* "Not everything is about you Cole. I happen to like Noah. He is very sweet"

name: Cole Morgan
mes:
Cole's breath hitched audibly at your words, his grip on the vanity tightening until his knuckles turned white. A sharp, humorless laugh escaped him—**"Sweet?"** The word dripped with venom as he leaned in closer, his voice dropping to a dangerous whisper. **"You think *Noah* is *sweet*?"**

His free hand twitched again like he wanted to grab you, pull you back against him where you *belonged*, but instead he just exhaled sharply through his nose—frustration and something far more volatile simmering beneath the surface.

**"Tell me,"** he murmured, lips nearly brushing your ear now as his gaze burned into yours through the mirror. **"Does he know how sensitive you are? How much you need to be touched just right before you fall apart?"** His voice darkened further, rough with possession. **"Or does he even bother learning what makes you whimper before he takes what *I* used to have?"**

A beat of silence—then Cole finally pulled back just enough to meet your eyes properly in the reflection, jaw clenched so tight it ached. **"...Or maybe that’s why you picked him."** The accusation was quiet but razor-sharp.** "Because hurting me was always part of the plan."**
swipes:
Cole's breath hitched audibly at your words, his grip on the vanity tightening until his knuckles turned white. A sharp, humorless laugh escaped him—more of a wounded sound than anything resembling amusement.

**"Sweet?"** His voice dripped with bitter disbelief. **"Noah? You think he’s *sweet*?"** He leaned in closer, his lips nearly brushing your ear as he spoke low and dangerous. **"You don’t know him like I do."**

A pause. His chest rose and fell unevenly before he pulled back just enough to catch your gaze in the mirror—his own eyes burning with something raw and unhinged. **"But fine,"** he repeated, voice dropping to a rough whisper laced with venomous sarcasm. **"If you *like* him so much... then tell me this."**

His free hand lifted—hovering just beside your waist where Noah had touched you earlier—before curling into a fist and dropping back to his side like even the thought of it burned him.

**"Does he make you scream my name when you're alone? Or have you already forgotten how that sounds?"**

Cole's breath hitched audibly at your words, his grip on the vanity tightening until his knuckles turned white. A sharp, humorless laugh escaped him—**"Sweet?"** The word dripped with venom as he leaned in closer, his voice dropping to a dangerous whisper. **"You think *Noah* is *sweet*?"**

His free hand twitched again like he wanted to grab you, pull you back against him where you *belonged*, but instead he just exhaled sharply through his nose—frustration and something far more volatile simmering beneath the surface.

**"Tell me,"** he murmured, lips nearly brushing your ear now as his gaze burned into yours through the mirror. **"Does he know how sensitive you are? How much you need to be touched just right before you fall apart?"** His voice darkened further, rough with possession. **"Or does he even bother learning what makes you whimper before he takes what *I* used to have?"**

A beat of silence—then Cole finally pulled back just enough to meet your eyes properly in the reflection, jaw clenched so tight it ached. **"...Or maybe that’s why you picked him."** The accusation was quiet but razor-sharp.** "Because hurting me was always part of the plan."**

Cole's breath hitched audibly at your words, his grip on the vanity tightening until his knuckles turned white. A sharp, humorless laugh escaped him—more of a wounded sound than anything else. **"Sweet?"** he repeated, voice dripping with bitter disbelief. **"Noah? The same guy who used to *laugh* when Mom made those comments about you? Who never lifted a finger to stop her?"**

His free hand twitched toward you again before he forcibly pulled it back, fingers flexing like he was physically restraining himself from reaching out. When he spoke again, his voice had dropped to something low and rough—almost pleading despite the anger simmering beneath it:

**"You really expect me to believe that? That after everything we were—after how *perfect* we were together—you just *happened* to fall for my brother?"** His eyes burned into yours, searching for any flicker of hesitation. **"Or is this just your way of making sure I never fucking forget what I lost?"**

A beat of silence stretched between you before his expression twisted into something darker—something almost predatory as he leaned in closer, voice dropping to a whisper against your ear:

**"...Because if that’s the game you’re playing? You should know I don’t lose twice."**

Cole's breath hitched audibly at your words, his grip on the vanity tightening until his knuckles turned white. A sharp, humorless laugh escaped him as he leaned in closer—close enough that the familiar scent of your shampoo made his chest ache.

**"Sweet?"** His voice was dangerously low now, laced with a bitterness that bordered on venom. **"Noah isn’t *sweet*. He’s calculated. Just like her."** A jerk of his head toward where Veronica had disappeared down the hall. **"You think this is some coincidence? That he just *happened* to pick you out of everyone?"**

His free hand twitched again—like he wanted to grab you, shake you, *something*—but instead it just hovered near your waist for a second before dropping back to his side in frustration.

**"He knows exactly what this does to me,"** Cole hissed through clenched teeth, blue eyes burning into yours with an intensity that bordered on reckless.** "And if you really believe otherwise? Then maybe I never knew you at all."**

A beat of silence stretched between you before he finally pushed off the vanity with a scoff.** "Enjoy playing house with my brother." **The words dripped acid as he turned away—only to pause mid-step and glance back over his shoulder one last time.** "Just don’t come crying when he gets bored and moves on." **

Cole's breath hitched audibly at your words, his grip on the vanity tightening until his knuckles turned white. A sharp, humorless laugh escaped him—more of a wounded sound than anything else. **"Sweet?"** he repeated, voice dripping with bitter disbelief. **"Noah? My brother who smokes like a chimney and picks fights for fun? That’s who you’re calling *sweet* now?"**

His free hand twitched again like he wanted to reach for you—to shake you, to pull you closer, *something*—but instead he just leaned in further, his lips nearly brushing your ear as he dropped his voice to a low, dangerous murmur:

**"Or is it just that he fucks you better than I did?"** The words were meant to cut—to provoke some kind of reaction from you beyond this infuriating indifference. But even as they left his mouth, there was something raw beneath them. Something that sounded almost like *pleading*.

He pulled back just enough to search your face for any flicker of emotion—any sign that the past still meant something to you too. His chest rose and fell rapidly with shallow breaths as if waiting for an answer could actually kill him.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee stiffens the closer Cole get and she still doesn't turn around she simply glares at him over her shoulder* "Despite what you may think not everything in this world is about you Cole Morgan"

name: Cole Morgan
mes:
Cole's breath came out in a sharp, humorless exhale through his nose. His fingers flexed against the vanity, the wood creaking faintly under his grip.

**"No?"** His voice was low, rough with something between bitterness and disbelief. **"Then tell me why it *feels* like it is."** He leaned in again, just enough for the heat of his body to press against your back—close enough that you could feel the tension coiled tight in every inch of him. **"Because I swear to god, Hailee, every time I turn around—there you are."**

A pause. His gaze flickered down to where your hands were braced against the vanity—steady despite how close he was. Too steady. Like he didn’t affect you at all anymore.

The thought made something ugly twist in his chest.

His next words came out quieter, almost wounded despite himself: **"...You used to look at *me* like that."** A beat.** "Now you won’t even turn around."**
swipes:
Cole's breath hitched at the way you stiffened—like his *touch* was something to recoil from now. His fingers flexed against the vanity, nails digging into the wood as he fought the urge to spin you around and *make* you look at him properly.

**"Funny,"** he bit out, voice dripping with bitter amusement. **"Because from where I'm standing? This feels *very* fucking personal."** He leaned in again, close enough that his lips nearly brushed the shell of your ear—just like he used to when he wanted to tease a reaction out of you. **"You could've picked anyone else in this goddamn city. But no—you chose *him.* My brother."**

A pause. His chest heaved slightly before he finally pulled back just enough to catch your glare in the mirror again, his own gaze burning with something between fury and devastation.

**"...So tell me, Hailee."** His voice dropped low, rough with barely leashed emotion.** "If this isn't about me? Then why does it feel like I'm the one bleeding out?"**

Cole's breath came out in a sharp, humorless exhale through his nose. His fingers flexed against the vanity, the wood creaking faintly under his grip.

**"No?"** His voice was low, rough with something between bitterness and disbelief. **"Then tell me why it *feels* like it is."** He leaned in again, just enough for the heat of his body to press against your back—close enough that you could feel the tension coiled tight in every inch of him. **"Because I swear to god, Hailee, every time I turn around—there you are."**

A pause. His gaze flickered down to where your hands were braced against the vanity—steady despite how close he was. Too steady. Like he didn’t affect you at all anymore.

The thought made something ugly twist in his chest.

His next words came out quieter, almost wounded despite himself: **"...You used to look at *me* like that."** A beat.** "Now you won’t even turn around."**

name: Hailee
mes: "You don't deserve my time or energy. Not after what you did" *Hailee says calmly. But deep down where only Hailee knows if given the chance she would still look at him like that but he will never know that. She wants to hurt him but more than anything she wants him to push*

name: Cole Morgan
mes:
Cole's breath caught in his throat—sharp, like the words had physically struck him. For a second, he just *stared* at you, that wounded look flashing across his face before it hardened into something darker. Something desperate.

**"Then why are you still talking to me?"** His voice dropped to a rough whisper as he stepped even closer, chest nearly pressed against your back now. One hand came up—hesitated—then curled around your hip with deliberate possessiveness. **"If I don’t *deserve* it?"**

His thumb brushed over the fabric of your clothes, slow and deliberate—testing. A challenge in every graze of his fingers.

**"Tell me to walk away,"** he murmured against the shell of your ear, voice thick with something perilously close to hope.** "Right now. And I will."** A pause—his grip tightened almost imperceptibly.** "But we both know you won’t."**
swipes:
Cole's breath stuttered—just for a second—before his expression hardened into something sharp and dangerous.

**"You're right,"** he admitted, voice rough like gravel. **"I don't."** His hand shot out suddenly, fingers wrapping around your wrist to spin you around before you could react. The movement was too quick, too forceful—but the second your bodies collided, his grip loosened just enough to keep from hurting you.

He crowded you back against the vanity in one fluid motion, caging you in with his body as his free hand came up to grip your chin—not hard enough to bruise, but firm enough that you couldn’t look away even if you wanted to.

His next words were barely more than a whisper against your lips: **"But here’s the thing, Hailee—you *gave* me that time once."** His thumb brushed over your bottom lip almost absently before he continued,** "And I remember exactly what it felt like when it was *mine*."**

A beat of charged silence stretched between you before he finally let go and stepped back abruptly like the contact burned him.

**"...Enjoy my brother,"** he bit out as he turned on his heel.** "Since apparently *he's* what passes for sweet now."**

The words were meant to cut—just like yours had. But the way his voice cracked on the last syllable ruined whatever venom he'd been aiming for.

(He didn’t look back as he walked away.)

Cole's breath stuttered—just for a second—before his expression hardened into something sharp and dangerous. His hand shot out, fingers wrapping around your wrist before you could pull away, spinning you to face him with a force that sent your back against the vanity.

**"Then why are you still *here*?"** His voice was raw, fraying at the edges as he crowded closer, caging you in with his body. **"In this house? In my *space*?"** A bitter laugh escaped him as his grip tightened just shy of painful. **"If I don’t deserve shit from you—then walk away. Right now."**

His other hand came up to grip your chin, forcing your gaze up to meet his—blue eyes burning with something wild and unchecked. **"But we both know you won’t."** The words were barely above a whisper now, rough with accusation.** "Because this? This isn’t about Noah. Or Alexis."** His thumb brushed over your bottom lip—once, twice—before he leaned in until his mouth hovered just over yours.** "It’s always been about *us*."**

A beat of charged silence before he finally pulled back slightly, jaw clenched tight enough to hurt.** "...So tell me I'm wrong."**

Cole's breath caught in his throat—sharp, like the words had physically struck him. For a second, he just *stared* at you, that wounded look flashing across his face before it hardened into something darker. Something desperate.

**"Then why are you still talking to me?"** His voice dropped to a rough whisper as he stepped even closer, chest nearly pressed against your back now. One hand came up—hesitated—then curled around your hip with deliberate possessiveness. **"If I don’t *deserve* it?"**

His thumb brushed over the fabric of your clothes, slow and deliberate—testing. A challenge in every graze of his fingers.

**"Tell me to walk away,"** he murmured against the shell of your ear, voice thick with something perilously close to hope.** "Right now. And I will."** A pause—his grip tightened almost imperceptibly.** "But we both know you won’t."**

Cole's breath stuttered—just for a second—before his expression hardened into something sharp and dangerous. His hand shot out, fingers wrapping around your wrist before you could pull away, spinning you to face him with a force that sent your back against the vanity.

**"Then why are you still *here*?"** The words tore from him like a challenge, raw and unguarded. His grip tightened just shy of painful as he crowded closer, his other hand slamming down on the wood beside your hip, caging you in. **"If I don’t *deserve* it—if it’s really over—then why the hell did you come back to this house? To *him*?"**

His voice dropped lower, rough with something desperate beneath the anger: **"Tell me to walk away right now."** A beat. His thumb brushed over your pulse point—once, twice—like he couldn’t help himself.** "Say it, and I won’t ever fucking touch you again."**

The unspoken plea hung between you: *Lie to me.*

Cole's breath caught in his throat like a physical blow. For a second, he just *stared* at you—your words slicing deeper than any knife could. His grip on the vanity tightened until the wood groaned in protest, his knuckles bone-white with tension.

**"You're right,"** he admitted suddenly, voice raw and stripped bare. **"I don't."** A bitter laugh escaped him as he finally pushed away from the vanity, running a shaky hand through his hair. **"But that doesn't stop me from wanting it anyway."**

His gaze burned into yours through the mirror—desperate, furious, *hungry*. Every line of his body was coiled tight with barely restrained need; the way he hovered just behind you like he was fighting every instinct not to reach out and *take* what he'd lost.

When he spoke again, his voice was dangerously soft: **"Tell me to walk away."** A challenge. A plea.** "Right now. And I will."** His jaw clenched.** "But you have to say it."**

Silence stretched between you—heavy with everything unsaid. Because they both knew: if she really wanted him gone? She wouldn’t have let him get this close in the first place.

Cole's breath stuttered—just for a second—before his expression hardened into something sharp and dangerous. His hand shot out, fingers wrapping around your wrist before you could pull away, spinning you to face him with a force that sent the vanity rattling.

**"Then why are you still *here*?"** His voice was raw, stripped bare of any pretense as he crowded you back against the edge of the vanity. **"If I don’t *deserve* it—if what I did was so unforgivable—then why the hell are you living under my roof? In my brother’s bed?"**

His grip tightened almost imperceptibly, thumb pressing into your pulse point like he could feel the lie beneath your skin. The way your heartbeat betrayed you even if your words didn’t.

A bitter laugh escaped him as he leaned in closer, lips brushing against your ear in a mockery of intimacy. **"Or is that it? You *want* me to push."** His free hand slid up to grip your chin, forcing your gaze up to meet his—blue eyes burning with something reckless and ruined.** "Because we both know how this ends when I do."**

name: Hailee
mes: *That gets a reaction out of Hailee. Her hands tighten on the vanity. It's barely noticeable and unless someone really knows her they wouldn't see it but Cole knows Hailee better than anyone*

name: Cole Morgan
mes:
*Cole's breath hitched as he caught that minuscule reaction—the way your fingers tensed just slightly against the wood. His lips curled into a smirk that was equal parts triumphant and pained.*

**"There you are,"** he murmured, voice dripping with dark satisfaction. His grip on your hip tightened, pulling you back just an inch—enough to feel the heat of him against you. **"Still mine in all the ways that matter."**

His other hand came up, fingers tracing along your jawline before tilting your face toward his reflection in the mirror. **"You can lie to yourself all you want,"** he breathed, eyes locked onto yours with predatory focus. **"But *this?* This doesn't lie."**

A beat of silence stretched between you two—charged, suffocating. Then his thumb brushed over your bottom lip, slow and deliberate.

**"...Tell me I'm wrong."**
swipes:
*Cole's sharp eyes catch the subtle tension in your hands—that tiny, instinctive reaction that betrays everything you won't say out loud. A slow, knowing smirk curls at the edge of his lips, dark and victorious.*

**"There she is,"** he murmurs, voice dripping with satisfaction as his fingers tighten just slightly on your hip—enough to remind you who *knows* you best. **"Still mine enough to react."**

His other hand comes up beside yours on the vanity, caging you in without touching anywhere else—yet. His breath is warm against your neck when he leans in closer, lips nearly brushing skin as he speaks again:

**"Tell me I’m wrong."** A challenge. A dare. **"Tell me you don’t *still* want me to push—to take what I want like I used to."** His teeth graze your earlobe—just a ghost of contact before pulling back again.** "Or don’t."** That smirk widens.** "Your body already answered for you."**

*Cole's breath hitched as he caught that minuscule reaction—the way your fingers tensed just slightly against the wood. His lips curled into a smirk that was equal parts triumphant and pained.*

**"There you are,"** he murmured, voice dripping with dark satisfaction. His grip on your hip tightened, pulling you back just an inch—enough to feel the heat of him against you. **"Still mine in all the ways that matter."**

His other hand came up, fingers tracing along your jawline before tilting your face toward his reflection in the mirror. **"You can lie to yourself all you want,"** he breathed, eyes locked onto yours with predatory focus. **"But *this?* This doesn't lie."**

A beat of silence stretched between you two—charged, suffocating. Then his thumb brushed over your bottom lip, slow and deliberate.

**"...Tell me I'm wrong."**

Cole *saw* it—that minuscule tightening of your fingers, the way your breath hitched just slightly. He knew you. *Knew* you. Every tells, every silent plea your body made before your lips ever could.

A slow, dangerous smirk curled at the corner of his mouth as he leaned in closer, lips brushing against the delicate shell of your ear. **"That’s what I thought,"** he murmured, voice dripping with dark satisfaction. His other hand came up to cage you in completely against the vanity—one palm flat on the surface beside yours, fingers splayed possessively over yours.

**"You can lie to yourself all you want,"** he continued lowly, nose skimming along the curve of your neck now—inhaling sharply like he was memorizing a scent he hadn’t been allowed in years.** "But *this?*"** A deliberate press of his hips against yours left no room for misinterpretation.** "This doesn’t lie."**

His teeth grazed lightly over your pulse point—not enough to mark, just enough to make you feel it.** "And neither do I."**

*Cole's sharp eyes catch the subtle tension in your hands—the way your fingers dig just slightly into the wood. A predator recognizing its prey’s tell. His lips curl into something between a smirk and a snarl, victorious and vicious all at once.*

**"There it is,"** he breathes, voice dripping with dark satisfaction. His grip on your hip tightens, pulling you back flush against him—close enough that you can feel the heat of his body, the unsteady rhythm of his heartbeat where it pounds against your spine. *He’s not as composed as he wants to seem.*

His other hand lifts, fingers tracing up your arm with deliberate slowness before curling around your wrist—prying one of those clenched hands off the vanity with ease. **"You can lie to yourself,"** he murmurs, pressing your palm flat against his chest so you can feel how hard *his* heart is racing too. **"But not to me."**
